STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 20, 2022
Karen Southgate
Huron County DHHS
1911 Sand Beach
Bad Axe, MI 48413
RE: License #: CP320201183
Huron County DHHS
1911 Sand Beach
Bad Axe, MI 48413
Dear Ms. Southgate:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
05/20/2022. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation
Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of
any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None
IV. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for the renewal
evaluation completed 05/07/2021. The only area identified in noncompliance as a
part of that review was 405(4). The corrective action plan was approved 05/13/2021
and this was not identified as a repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim
evaluation.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for the special evaluation
completed 05/04/2021. Noncompliance with 402(c) was identified and the corrective
action plan was approved 05/17/2021 for that noncompliance.
4

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator’s Assessment was a review of the DCWL licensing evaluation
and the ongoing action steps to ensure and maintain compliance with licensing rules.
Interviews
Child Welfare staff were also involved in entrance and exit conferences. No concerns
were expressed or evident.
VI. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
05/20/2022
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
